body_html:
@wt-huang

config.gpu_options.allow_growth = True
I've configured this option but I know for a fact that I am not using a GPU.
I've also removed it before running the code again and it still hangs. Have you been able to replicate the issue?

I should note that I am still running this distributed architecture completely on a local machine. Would this have an effect on whether or not the program hangs? (I am still a beginner at distributed computing in general).

Also, make sure the chief worker is consistent in the setup, notice some discrepancy here:

That's totally my fault. Sorry for the confusion this may have caused. But this sentence

For the moment, I've bypassed this issue by passing the summary hook object to the non-chief worker(task:0).

Should really say

For the moment, I've bypassed this issue by passing the summary hook object to the non-chief worker(task:1).

I've edited the original description to reflect the change.

@wt-huang
config.gpu_options.allow_growth = True
I've configured this option but I know for a fact that I am not using a GPU.
I've also removed it before running the code again and it still hangs. Have you been able to replicate the issue?
I should note that I am still running this distributed architecture completely on a local machine. Would this have an effect on whether or not the program hangs? (I am still a beginner at distributed computing in general).

Also, make sure the chief worker is consistent in the setup, notice some discrepancy here:

That's totally my fault. Sorry for the confusion this may have caused. But this sentence

For the moment, I've bypassed this issue by passing the summary hook object to the non-chief worker(task:0).

Should really say

For the moment, I've bypassed this issue by passing the summary hook object to the non-chief worker(task:1).

I've edited the original description to reflect the change.
body:
@wt-huang

`
config.gpu_options.allow_growth = True
`
I've configured this option but I know for a fact that I am not using a GPU. 
I've also removed it before running the code again and it still hangs. Have you been able to replicate the issue? 

I should note that I am still running this distributed architecture completely on a local machine. Would this have an effect on whether or not the program hangs? (I am still a beginner at distributed computing in general).

> Also, make sure the chief worker is consistent in the setup, notice some discrepancy here:

That's totally my fault. Sorry for the confusion this may have caused. But this sentence

>For the moment, I've bypassed this issue by passing the summary hook object to the non-chief worker(task:0).

Should really say

>For the moment, I've bypassed this issue by passing the summary hook object to the non-chief worker(task:1).

I've edited the original description to reflect the change.
